channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023080075
item.description:
Report E-2023080075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2924 "M2488" release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and a tote transfer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12-ounces of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. Crew began by neutralizing the released product with a soda ash solution and using spill pads to collect all free-standing liquid. The product was then transferred into a new tote for shipment on. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with the spill pads and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: AURORA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking in the load side. Package was then segregated into a damage tote with a liner and brought to QA. Upon inspection, contents were found with loosed caps. DescribePack: Caps were loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with bag liner observing orientation arrows.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered on van line four, during preload, by an admin. The admin placed the pkg in plastic bag within a red tote and stored it QA1. DescribePack: This drum had a loose cap which caused it to leak ethyl alcohol. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was placed in a plastic bag and red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080104
item.description:
Report X-2023080104

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking in the load side. Once discovered, QA was called. Neutralizer was used on the liquid that spilled on the floor, after absorbent pads were applied. Package was placed into a damage tote complete with liner; orientation arrows being followed. DescribePack: Cap was loose, but not completely detached, however the seal was broken slightly allowing for the leak to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with liner, orientation arrows followed. Any spillage that was not contained to the package itself was contained with absorbent pads and neutralizer.

item.title: Report E-2023070952
item.description:
Report E-2023070952

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading a trailer at Veolia 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO, Veolia operators discovered that the load had shifted during transportation. While attempting to upright and offload the drum it fell and cracked, resulting in an approximate 5 gallon release of liquid to the trailer floor and containment beneath the trailer. Veolia personnel neutralized and cleaned up the spill immediately upon discovery and overpacked the leaking drum.
